de.mrapp.android.preference.activity.view

Class ToolbarLarge

  • java.lang.Object
    • FrameLayout
      • de.mrapp.android.preference.activity.view.ToolbarLarge

  • public class ToolbarLarge
extends FrameLayout
    A custom view, which may be used to visualize a large toolbar on devices with a large screen.
    Since:
    2.0.0
    Author:
    Michael Rapp

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ToolbarLarge(Context context)
      Creates a custom view, which may be used to visualize a large toolbar on devices with a large screen.

      Creates a custom view, which may be used to visualize a large toolbar on devices with a large screen.
      ToolbarLarge(Context context, AttributeSet attributeSet, int defaultStyle)
      Creates a custom view, which may be used to visualize a large toolbar on devices with a large screen.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ToolbarLarge

        public ToolbarLarge(Context context)
        Creates a custom view, which may be used to visualize a large toolbar on devices with a large screen.
        Parameters:
        context - The context, the toolbar should belong to, as an instance of the class Context. The context may not be null

      • ToolbarLarge

        public ToolbarLarge(Context context,
                    AttributeSet attributeSet)
        Creates a custom view, which may be used to visualize a large toolbar on devices with a large screen.
        Parameters:
        context - The context, the toolbar should belong to, as an instance of the class Context. The context may not be null
        attributeSet - The attributes of the XML tag that is inflating the preference, as an instance of the type AttributeSet. The attribute set may not be null

      • ToolbarLarge

        public ToolbarLarge(Context context,
                    AttributeSet attributeSet,
                    int defaultStyle)
        Creates a custom view, which may be used to visualize a large toolbar on devices with a large screen.
        Parameters:
        context - The context, the toolbar should belong to, as an instance of the class Context. The context may not be null
        attributeSet - The attributes of the XML tag that is inflating the preference, as an instance of the type AttributeSet. The attribute set may not be null
        defaultStyle - The default style to apply to this preference. If 0, no style will be applied (beyond what is included in the theme). This may either be an attribute resource, whose value will be retrieved from the current theme, or an explicit style resource

    • Method Detail

      • getTitle

        public final CharSequence getTitle()
        Returns the toolbar's title.
        Returns:
        The toolbar's title as an instance of the class CharSequence or null, if no title is set

      • setTitle

        public final void setTitle(CharSequence title)
        Sets the toolbar's title.
        Parameters:
        title - The title, which should be set, as an instance of the class CharSequence or null, if no title should be set

      • setTitle

        public final void setTitle(int resourceId)
        Sets the toolbar's title.
        Parameters:
        resourceId - The resource id of the title, which should be set, as an Integer value. The resource id must correspond to a valid string resource

      • getBreadCrumbTitle

        public final CharSequence getBreadCrumbTitle()
        Returns the bread crumb title of the currently selected preference header.
        Returns:
        The bread crumb title of the currently selected preference header as an instance of the class CharSequence or null, if no bread crumb title is set

      • setBreadCrumbTitle

        public final void setBreadCrumbTitle(CharSequence title)
        Sets the bread crumb title of the currently selected preference header.
        Parameters:
        title - The bread crumb title, which should be set, as an instance of the class CharSequence or null, of no bread crumb title should be set

      • setBreadCrumbTitle

        public final void setBreadCrumbTitle(int resourceId)
        Sets the bread crumb title of the currently selected preference header.
        Parameters:
        resourceId - The resource id of the bread crumb title, which should be set, as an Integer value. The resource id must correspond to a valid string resource

      • getNavigationWidth

        public final int getNavigationWidth()
        Returns the width of the navigation.
        Returns:
        The width of the navigation in dp as an Integer value

      • setNavigationWidth

        public final void setNavigationWidth(int width)
        Sets the width of the navigation.
        Parameters:
        width - The width, which should be set, in dp as an Integer value. The width must be greater than 0

      • isNavigationHidden

        public final boolean isNavigationHidden()
        Returns, whether the navigation is hidden, or not.
        Returns:
        True, if the navigation is hidden, false otherwise

      • hideNavigation

        public final void hideNavigation(boolean navigationHidden)
        Hides or shows the navigation.
        Parameters:
        navigationHidden - True, if the navigation should be hidden, false otherwise

      • getNavigationElevation

        public final int getNavigationElevation()
        Returns the elevation of the navigation.
        Returns:
        The elevation of the navigation in dp as an Integer value

      • setNavigationElevation

        public final void setNavigationElevation(int elevation)
        Sets the elevation of the navigation.
        Parameters:
        elevation - The elevation, which should be set, in dp as an Integer value. The elevation must be at least 1 and at maximum 5
